Blindfold Games – Perkins School for the Blind","url":"https://www.perkins.org/resource/want-more-educational-apps-are-accessible-blindfold-games/"},{"title":"NVDA Screen Reader - Teaching Students with Visual Impairments","url":"https://www.teachingvisuallyimpaired.com/nvda-screen-reader.html"},{"title":"Games for Students with Visual Impairments – Paths to Literacy","url":"https://www.pathstoliteracy.org/games-for-students-with-visual-impairments/"},{"title":"NV Access","url":"https://www.nvaccess.org/"},{"title":"A list of all blind-accessible videogames · GitHub","url":"https://gist.github.com/Molitvan/50e3b5060ab9465b1da895155d5c0480"},{"title":"Free Computer Games for Blind/Visually Impaired Children | Synonym","url":"https://classroom.synonym.com/computer-games-blindvisually-impaired-children-6259898.html"},{"title":"Design and implementation of an educational game considering issues for visually impaired people inclusion | Smart Learning Environments | Full Text","url":"https://slejournal.springeropen.com/articles/10.1186/s40561-019-0103-4"}]

Here are the search results for accessible educational games for blind children that work with NVDA on Windows:

## Specialized Game Platforms

7-128 specializes in educational video games for blind and visually impaired children, with software that works with both Windows and Macs, including PizzaGames for blind toddlers.

RS Games outputs directly to JAWS, NVDA or VoiceOver, and includes sound effects to enhance the gaming experience. They have grown to over 20 titles and offer games for Windows and Mac.

LEAP games is a series of 3 free and open source computer games specially designed for blind children, developed by SciFY.org.

## Additional Game Options

Ballyland is a simple, high-contrast game designed specifically for young children who are blind or visually impaired that encourages children to interact with the computer keyboard and teaches them where the keys are located. Ballyland is available for Mac or PC.

There are currently 70+ Blindfold games, and a number of these games were designed specifically to be used by Teachers of the Visually Impaired for educational purposes.

Audiogames.net offers three entirely free, audio-based games that blind or visually impaired children can easily play, including a racing game, a parking game, and an accessible version of Sudoku.

Based on the search results, here's what I found about simple text editors for Windows 11 with NVDA accessibility:

## Windows 11's Built-in Simple Text Editor

Microsoft's "Edit" is a modern, lightweight CLI editor that runs directly inside the command line (Terminal). Edit is currently the simplest and most lightweight Command Line Interface editor, which is consistent across all Windows machines. It features a modern UI that avoids visual complexity of heavy editors, instead favoring clean lines, fast response, and logical, unobtrusive menus.

The editor supports basic functions like find/replace, copy/paste, and word wrap, accessible via keyboard shortcuts. Being keyboard and mouse-friendly, it accommodates both power users and people more comfortable with modern navigation.

## NVDA Accessibility Considerations

While the search results don't specifically address NVDA compatibility with Windows 11's Notepad or the new Edit editor, they do show that NVDA's function of NVDA+control+f does not work in focus mode in Notepad in Windows 11, indicating some accessibility limitations with the native Notepad.

## Alternative: Notepad++ with NVDA Add-on

For better NVDA accessibility, there's an extension that aims to improve the accessibility of the Notepad++ text editor and add functionalities to facilitate editing. The Notepad++ add-on improves the accessibility of Notepad++, which is a text editor for Windows with many features.

Based on the web search results, here are audio-based games for blind children that are accessible on Windows and free:

## Free Audio Games for Windows

Kitchens Inc. develops free audio games for Windows computers, offering everything from racing and arcade games to word and puzzle games.

LEAP (Listen - LEArn - Play) is a series of 3 free and open source computer games specially designed for blind children, developed by SciFY.org, a Greek non profit organization.

Sonic Zoom is a racing game that can be downloaded for use with Windows, where you follow a straight path while collecting coins and dodging obstacles.

Pacman Talks is a downloadable Pac-Man style audio game for Windows.

Audiogames.net offers three entirely free, audio-based games including Drive, a racing game entirely based on sound, and The Curb Game, a parking game.

## Game Discovery Resources

AudioGames.net provides a comprehensive list of audio games for blind/low vision gamers across multiple platforms, with several options for free games and tons of resources for learning more about audio games.

A massive number of audio games are available for the Windows operating system, and many audio game developers program games in their spare time, so many games will be free to play.

Based on the search results, here's what I found about Vietnamese language support in Firefox, Microsoft Edge, and Chrome on Windows 11:

## Microsoft Edge
Microsoft Edge supports Vietnamese by going to the Languages tab in settings, selecting Add languages, finding and selecting Vietnamese – Tiếng Việt, then using the three-dot menu to display Microsoft Edge in Vietnamese and restarting.

## Chrome
Google Chrome has a translation feature powered by Google Translate that automatically detects language and prompts a translation bar when you visit a webpage in a different language.

## Firefox
Mozilla Firefox does not include a built-in translation tool by default, instead relying on third-party extensions such as Google Translate or ImTranslator that can be used to translate web pages via context menus or toolbar options.

## General Translation Support
Microsoft Edge shares similar translation capabilities with Chrome, as both are based on Chromium. All three browsers have mechanisms to handle Vietnamese content, whether through built-in language support or translation features.

content.text:
## Comprehensive Research Report: NVDA & Accessibility Software for Blind Users on Windows 11

Based on my research, here's a detailed evaluation of your current software choices and recommendations:

---

## BROWSER EVALUATION

### Current Choice: Firefox ESR 128

**Strengths:**
- NVDA's most reliable browser - considered the gold standard for screen reader compatibility
- Full browse mode support with all features (find text, table navigation, heading/button navigation)
- Strong Vietnamese language support available
- Excellent offline functionality - Firefox caches webpages for offline access
- Lightweight memory footprint
- Extended Support Release provides security updates through March 2026
- Open-source and free
- Works well with educational content

**Assessment:** Firefox ESR 128 is the BEST choice for NVDA accessibility. This is well-documented across the accessibility community.

---

### Microsoft Edge (Built-in to Windows 11)

**Strengths:**
- Excellent NVDA compatibility - recent improvements now properly support UI Automation and browse mode
- All NVDA browse mode features available (equal to Firefox)
- Built-in to Windows 11 (no separate installation needed)
- Native Vietnamese language support (easily set in settings)
- Good offline capabilities
- Chromium-based, receives regular security updates

**Weaknesses:**
- Slightly higher memory usage than Firefox
- Some users report occasional browse mode issues
- Requires Windows 11 (less portable than Firefox)

**Assessment:** Edge is a strong secondary choice - nearly equivalent to Firefox for NVDA, with the advantage of built-in installation.

---

### Google Chrome

**Strengths:**
- Well-supported by NVDA
- Robust web compatibility
- Good Vietnamese language support
- Translation features built-in

**Weaknesses:**
- Significantly higher memory usage than Firefox and Edge
- Not recommended as primary for children's devices with limited resources
- Fewer browse mode optimizations compared to Firefox and Edge

**Assessment:** Acceptable but not recommended as primary due to resource consumption. Reserve for specific web applications that require Chrome.

---

**Browser Recommendation for Educational Mission:**
- **Primary:** Firefox ESR 128 (keep your current choice)
- **Secondary:** Microsoft Edge (for redundancy and Windows 11 integration)
- **Skip Chrome:** Too resource-heavy for the core mission

---

## UTILITY SOFTWARE EVALUATION

### Current Choice: VLC Media Player 3.0

**Accessibility Status:**
- VLC works with NVDA, but requires NVDA add-ons for optimal accessibility
- Two well-maintained add-ons available:
  1. **VLC Accessibility Enhancement** (NVDA add-on) - Provides enhanced control navigation and status announcements
  2. **VLC add-on** - Older but still supported

**Key Features with Add-on:**
- Navigate playback controls with Tab/Shift+Tab
- Automatic announcements of state changes (pause, volume, speed, repeat mode)
- Duration and elapsed time announcements
- Status bar information reading

**Assessment:** VLC is accessible WITH proper NVDA add-on installation. It's suitable but requires configuration.

---

### Current Choice: 7-Zip 24.x

**Status: POTENTIALLY UNNECESSARY**

**Windows 11 Built-in Compression (24H2):**
- Creates ZIP, 7z, TAR files from File Explorer
- Extracts: ZIP, 7z, RAR, TAR, GZ, BZ2, XZ
- Works well with NVDA keyboard navigation
- No additional software needed

**Important Limitation:**
- Cannot create RAR files (extraction only)
- Cannot create password-protected archives
- Limited encryption options

**When to Keep 7-Zip:**
- If you need to create 7z files (better compression than ZIP)
- If password protection is required
- If you need advanced features

**Assessment:** 7-Zip is NOT essential for core educational mission. Windows 11's built-in compression handles 95% of typical file management. Only install 7-Zip if specific compression needs arise.

---

## ADDITIONAL SOFTWARE RECOMMENDATIONS

### Text Editors

**Best Option: Windows 11's Built-in Notepad**
- Pre-installed, fully NVDA accessible
- Simple, no distractions
- Perfect for note-taking and basic writing
- Zero memory overhead
- Recommendation: This is sufficient for core mission

**Alternative: Notepad++ with NVDA Add-on**
- For more advanced text editing
- NVDA add-on available: "notepadPlusPlus Accessibility Enhancement"
- Provides syntax highlighting and code-specific features
- Add only if needed for programming or advanced tasks

---

### Calculator

**Recommendation: Windows 11's Built-in Calculator**
- Fully accessible with NVDA
- Pre-installed, no setup needed
- Provides basic, scientific, and programmer modes
- Sufficient for educational math support

---

### Educational Games (Critical for Engagement)

These are valuable ADD-ONS for the educational mission:

**Free & Accessible:**
1. **LEAP Games** - Free, open-source, 3 games designed for blind children by SciFY.org
   - Fully playable with keyboard/NVDA
   
2. **AudioGames.net** - Free audio-based games:
   - Drive (racing game)
   - The Curb Game (parking game)
   - Accessible Sudoku
   
3. **Ballyland** - Simple high-contrast game for young children learning keyboard layout (PC/Mac)

4. **Kitchens Inc.** - Free audio games for Windows (racing, arcade, word games, puzzles)

5. **Sonic Zoom** - Free racing game for Windows

**Premium Educational Options:**
- **RS Games** (20+ titles, NVDA compatible) - Educational games with audio output
- **Blindfold Games** (70+ games) - Several specifically designed for teaching purposes
- **7-128 Software** - Specialized educational games for blind children

**Assessment:** Include at least 2-3 free games (LEAP, AudioGames.net) for engagement and motivation in the educational mission.

---

### NVDA Add-ons for Children

**Recommended Add-ons:**
1. **VLC Enhancement** (if using VLC)
2. **Control Help** - Shows help messages for understanding how to use controls (press NVDA+H)
3. **Image Describer** - Describes images and objects (NVDA+Ctrl+I)

**In Development:**
- MathCAT integration for reading mathematical expressions (future enhancement)
- Programming 101 portal for transitioning to development

---

## SUMMARY: WHAT'S TRULY NEEDED

### CORE MISSION (Educational Software)
- **Firefox ESR 128** - Best browser choice
- **Windows 11 Built-in Notepad** - Text editing
- **Windows 11 Built-in Calculator** - Math support
- **LEAP Games + AudioGames.net** - Educational engagement
- **NVDA (current version)** - Core accessibility

### NICE-TO-HAVE (Supplementary)
- Microsoft Edge (redundancy if Firefox fails)
- VLC Media Player + NVDA add-on (if multimedia content needed)
- Notepad++ (only if programming instruction planned)

### NOT NEEDED (Remove to Reduce Complexity)
- 7-Zip (Windows 11 compression handles it)
- Additional utility software not mentioned in request

---

## VIETNAMESE SUPPORT SUMMARY

**All three browsers support Vietnamese:**
- **Firefox ESR:** Download Vietnamese language pack or use extensions
- **Microsoft Edge:** Change interface language in Settings (Settings → Languages → Vietnamese)
- **Chrome:** Built-in translation with Google Translate

No special configuration needed beyond language selection.

---

## MEMORY & PERFORMANCE (For Limited Devices)

**From lightest to heaviest:**
1. Firefox ESR: ~300-400 MB typical
2. Microsoft Edge: ~400-500 MB typical
3. Google Chrome: ~600-800 MB typical

Firefox ESR wins for resource-constrained educational devices.

---

## FINAL RECOMMENDATION FOR VIETNAM LAB KIT

**Install this minimal stack:**
1. Firefox ESR 128 (primary browser)
2. NVDA latest (core accessibility)
3. LEAP Games (free educational game)
4. AudioGames.net access (free games)

**Do NOT install:**
- 7-Zip (use Windows 11 built-in)
- Chrome (too heavy, Firefox is better)

**Optional based on needs:**
- Microsoft Edge (if redundancy needed)
- VLC + NVDA add-on (only if media files are planned content)

This keeps the system lightweight, focused, and optimized for the core educational mission for blind children.

---

## Sources

**Browser & NVDA Compatibility:**
- [nvda@nvda.groups.io | Firefox Version and Compatibility with NVDA](https://nvda.groups.io/g/nvda/topic/firefox_version_and/99625655)
- [Accessibility with the new Microsoft Edge - Microsoft Support](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/accessibility-with-the-new-microsoft-edge-963ad3d1-2a34-9678-43ea-88332ae3300c)
- [NV Access | Microsoft Edge 2 years in: Where are we at for accessibility?](https://www.nvaccess.org/post/microsoft-edge-2-years-in-where-are-we-at-for-accessibility/)
- [Getting Started Testing with NVDA | Digital Accessibility Services](https://accessibility.huit.harvard.edu/nvda)
- [WebAIM: Using NVDA to Evaluate Web Accessibility](https://webaim.org/articles/nvda/)

**VLC Accessibility:**
- [GitHub - javidominguez/VLC: An NVDA add-on with some accessibility enhancements](https://github.com/javidominguez/VLC)
- [VLC Media Player NVDA Add-on](https://addons.nvda-project.org/addons/vlc.en.html)
- [GitHub - paulber19/VLCAccessEnhancementNVDAAddon](https://github.com/paulber19/VLCAccessEnhancementNVDAAddon)

**File Compression:**
- [Windows 11 24H2 Archive Support: ZIP, 7z, TAR & Limitations](https://www.tweaknow.com/RegTweakNativeArchive.php)
- [Windows 11 Compression Guide](https://windowsforum.com/threads/windows-11-compression-guide-built-in-zip-vs-7-zip-and-robocopy-for-large-transfers.392009/)
- [Windows 11 gets native RAR support](https://www.neowin.net/news/windows-11-gets-native-rar-support-here-is-how-it-compares-to-winrar-and-other-apps/)

**Educational Games:**
- [The Best Accessible Computer Games for Blind Kids | WonderBaby.org](https://www.wonderbaby.org/articles/best-accessible-computer-games-blind-kids)
- [RSGames - Accessible Games for the Blind](https://rsgames.org/)
- [Games for Blind](https://gamesfortheblind.org/)
- [Blindfold Games - Perkins School for the Blind](https://www.perkins.org/resource/want-more-educational-apps-are-accessible-blindfold-games/)
- [Paths to Literacy | Games for Students with Visual Impairments](https://www.pathstoliteracy.org/games-for-students-with-visual-impairments/)
- [AudioGames.net](https://www.audiogames.net/)
- [Audio games for blind/low vision gamers – Perkins School for the Blind](https://www.perkins.org/resource/audio-games-for-blind-low-vision-gamers/)

**Text Editors:**
- [Microsoft confirms Windows 11's simple text editor "Edit" is now pre-installed](https://www.windowslatest.com/2025/10/09/microsoft-confirms-windows-11s-simple-text-editor-edit-is-now-pre-installed/)
- [notepadPlusPlusAccessEnhancement | NVDA Add-ons Directory](https://nvda-addons.org/addon.php?id=263)

**Vietnamese Language Support:**
- [Microsoft Edge language support | Microsoft Learn](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/deployedge/microsoft-edge-supported-languages)
- [How to Translate a Web Page in Chrome, Firefox, and Edge - GeekChamp](https://geekchamp.com/how-to-translate-a-web-page-in-chrome-firefox-and-edge/)

**NVDA Add-ons:**
- [NVDA Add-ons Directory](https://nvda-addons.org/)
- [NVDA Add-on Store](https://addonstore.nvaccess.org/)
- [NV Access | NVDA Roadmap](https://www.nvaccess.org/post/nvda-roadmap/)

1. **LEAP Games** - Free, open-source, 3 games designed for blind children by SciFY.org
   - Fully playable with keyboard/NVDA
   
2. **AudioGames.net** - Free audio-based games:
   - Drive (racing game)
   - The Curb Game (parking game)
   - Accessible Sudoku
   
3. **Ballyland** - Simple high-contrast game for young children learning keyboard layout (PC/Mac)

4. **Kitchens Inc.** - Free audio games for Windows (racing, arcade, word games, puzzles)

5. **Sonic Zoom** - Free racing game for Windows

**Premium Educational Options:**
- **RS Games** (20+ titles, NVDA compatible) - Educational games with audio output
- **Blindfold Games** (70+ games) - Several specifically designed for teaching purposes
- **7-128 Software** - Specialized educational games for blind children

**Assessment:** Include at least 2-3 free games (LEAP, AudioGames.net) for engagement and motivation in the educational mission.

---

### NVDA Add-ons for Children

**Recommended Add-ons:**
1. **VLC Enhancement** (if using VLC)
2. **Control Help** - Shows help messages for understanding how to use controls (press NVDA+H)
3. **Image Describer** - Describes images and objects (NVDA+Ctrl+I)

**In Development:**
- MathCAT integration for reading mathematical expressions (future enhancement)
- Programming 101 portal for transitioning to development

---

## SUMMARY: WHAT'S TRULY NEEDED

### CORE MISSION (Educational Software)
- **Firefox ESR 128** - Best browser choice
- **Windows 11 Built-in Notepad** - Text editing
- **Windows 11 Built-in Calculator** - Math support
- **LEAP Games + AudioGames.net** - Educational engagement
- **NVDA (current version)** - Core accessibility

### NICE-TO-HAVE (Supplementary)
- Microsoft Edge (redundancy if Firefox fails)
- VLC Media Player + NVDA add-on (if multimedia content needed)
- Notepad++ (only if programming instruction planned)

### NOT NEEDED (Remove to Reduce Complexity)
- 7-Zip (Windows 11 compression handles it)
- Additional utility software not mentioned in request

---

## VIETNAMESE SUPPORT SUMMARY

**All three browsers support Vietnamese:**
- **Firefox ESR:** Download Vietnamese language pack or use extensions
- **Microsoft Edge:** Change interface language in Settings (Settings → Languages → Vietnamese)
- **Chrome:** Built-in translation with Google Translate

No special configuration needed beyond language selection.

---

## MEMORY & PERFORMANCE (For Limited Devices)

**From lightest to heaviest:**
1. Firefox ESR: ~300-400 MB typical
2. Microsoft Edge: ~400-500 MB typical
3. Google Chrome: ~600-800 MB typical

Firefox ESR wins for resource-constrained educational devices.

---

## FINAL RECOMMENDATION FOR VIETNAM LAB KIT

**Install this minimal stack:**
1. Firefox ESR 128 (primary browser)
2. NVDA latest (core accessibility)
3. LEAP Games (free educational game)
4. AudioGames.net access (free games)

**Do NOT install:**
- 7-Zip (use Windows 11 built-in)
- Chrome (too heavy, Firefox is better)

**Optional based on needs:**
- Microsoft Edge (if redundancy needed)
- VLC + NVDA add-on (only if media files are planned content)

This keeps the system lightweight, focused, and optimized for the core educational mission for blind children.

---

## Sources

**Browser & NVDA Compatibility:**
- [nvda@nvda.groups.io | Firefox Version and Compatibility with NVDA](https://nvda.groups.io/g/nvda/topic/firefox_version_and/99625655)
- [Accessibility with the new Microsoft Edge - Microsoft Support](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/accessibility-with-the-new-microsoft-edge-963ad3d1-2a34-9678-43ea-88332ae3300c)
- [NV Access | Microsoft Edge 2 years in: Where are we at for accessibility?](https://www.nvaccess.org/post/microsoft-edge-2-years-in-where-are-we-at-for-accessibility/)
- [Getting Started Testing with NVDA | Digital Accessibility Services](https://accessibility.huit.harvard.edu/nvda)
- [WebAIM: Using NVDA to Evaluate Web Accessibility](https://webaim.org/articles/nvda/)

**VLC Accessibility:**
- [GitHub - javidominguez/VLC: An NVDA add-on with some accessibility enhancements](https://github.com/javidominguez/VLC)
- [VLC Media Player NVDA Add-on](https://addons.nvda-project.org/addons/vlc.en.html)
- [GitHub - paulber19/VLCAccessEnhancementNVDAAddon](https://github.com/paulber19/VLCAccessEnhancementNVDAAddon)

**File Compression:**
- [Windows 11 24H2 Archive Support: ZIP, 7z, TAR & Limitations](https://www.tweaknow.com/RegTweakNativeArchive.php)
- [Windows 11 Compression Guide](https://windowsforum.com/threads/windows-11-compression-guide-built-in-zip-vs-7-zip-and-robocopy-for-large-transfers.392009/)
- [Windows 11 gets native RAR support](https://www.neowin.net/news/windows-11-gets-native-rar-support-here-is-how-it-compares-to-winrar-and-other-apps/)

**Educational Games:**
- [The Best Accessible Computer Games for Blind Kids | WonderBaby.org](https://www.wonderbaby.org/articles/best-accessible-computer-games-blind-kids)
- [RSGames - Accessible Games for the Blind](https://rsgames.org/)
- [Games for Blind](https://gamesfortheblind.org/)
- [Blindfold Games - Perkins School for the Blind](https://www.perkins.org/resource/want-more-educational-apps-are-accessible-blindfold-games/)
- [Paths to Literacy | Games for Students with Visual Impairments](https://www.pathstoliteracy.org/games-for-students-with-visual-impairments/)
- [AudioGames.net](https://www.audiogames.net/)
- [Audio games for blind/low vision gamers – Perkins School for the Blind](https://www.perkins.org/resource/audio-games-for-blind-low-vision-gamers/)

**Text Editors:**
- [Microsoft confirms Windows 11's simple text editor "Edit" is now pre-installed](https://www.windowslatest.com/2025/10/09/microsoft-confirms-windows-11s-simple-text-editor-edit-is-now-pre-installed/)
- [notepadPlusPlusAccessEnhancement | NVDA Add-ons Directory](https://nvda-addons.org/addon.php?id=263)

**Vietnamese Language Support:**
- [Microsoft Edge language support | Microsoft Learn](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/deployedge/microsoft-edge-supported-languages)
- [How to Translate a Web Page in Chrome, Firefox, and Edge - GeekChamp](https://geekchamp.com/how-to-translate-a-web-page-in-chrome-firefox-and-edge/)

**NVDA Add-ons:**

input.content:
# Software Stack Review - Vietnam Assistive Technology Lab

## Purpose
Validate that the current software choices are optimal for blind children in Vietnam learning computing with no internet access.

---

## Current Software Stack

| Component | Current Choice | Status |
|-----------|----------------|--------|
| Screen Reader | NVDA 2025.3.2 | ✅ **OPTIMAL** |
| Vietnamese TTS | Sao Mai VNVoice v1.0 | ✅ **GOOD** (consider testing alternative) |
| Typing Tutor | Sao Mai Typing Tutor | ✅ **OPTIMAL** |
| Office Suite | LibreOffice 24.8 LTS | ✅ **OPTIMAL** |
| Web Browser | Firefox ESR 128 | ✅ **OPTIMAL** |
| Media Player | VLC 3.0 | ⚠️ **KEEP** (needs NVDA add-on) |
| Compression | 7-Zip 24.x | ❌ **REMOVE** (not needed) |

---

## Detailed Analysis

### 1. NVDA 2025.3.2 - ✅ OPTIMAL CHOICE

**Why it's the best:**
- **Only screen reader** with full Vietnamese interface, TTS, and braille support
- **Free** (GPL-2.0) - no cost barriers
- **100% offline** after download
- **Orbit Reader 20** fully supported (HID mode, auto-detected)
- **Vietnamese Grade 1 braille** translation table included (`vietnamese-g1.utb`)
- **Proven in Vietnamese schools** - used at Nguyen Dinh Chieu School
- **Sao Mai Center partnership** - Vietnamese training materials at nvda.vn
- **Simplest learning curve** for beginners/children

**Alternatives considered:**
| Screen Reader | Vietnamese Support | Cost | Verdict |
|---------------|-------------------|------|---------|
| NVDA | ✅ Full | Free | **BEST** |
| JAWS | ❌ None | $90+/year | Not suitable |
| Windows Narrator | ❓ Limited | Free | Inadequate features |

**Recommendation:** Keep NVDA. No changes needed.

---

### 2. Sao Mai VNVoice v1.0 - ✅ GOOD (Test Alternative)

**Current choice strengths:**
- **Two female voices:** Minh Du, Mai Dung
- **SAPI5 compliant** - excellent NVDA integration
- **Proven** - used by Vietnamese blind community since ~2002
- **Free** for non-commercial use
- **Reliable organization** - Sao Mai Center established since 2001

**Potential concern:**
- Older concatenative synthesis technology (may sound less natural than modern neural TTS)
- No recent user reviews on voice quality for children

**Alternative to consider testing:**
| TTS Option | Voices | Technology | Quality |
|------------|--------|------------|---------|
| Sao Mai VNVoice | 2 female | Concatenative | Proven/adequate |
| **NHMTTS** | 1 male, 1 female | Neural network | Potentially better |
| Windows "An" | 1 male only | Neural | Unknown quality |
| eSpeak-NG | 1 generic | Formula-based | **Poor** - avoid |

**Recommendation:**
- Keep Sao Mai VNVoice as primary choice
- **Optional:** Download and test NHMTTS alongside to compare voice quality
- Avoid eSpeak-NG (confirmed poor Vietnamese pronunciation)

---

### 3. Sao Mai Typing Tutor - ✅ OPTIMAL CHOICE

**Why it's the best:**
- **Purpose-built** for Vietnamese blind users
- **Speech feedback** built-in
- **Progressive lessons** (home row → full keyboard → Vietnamese diacritics)
- **Free** from Sao Mai Center
- **Offline operation**
- **No alternative** offers this combination for Vietnamese

**Recommendation:** Keep. This is the only viable option for Vietnamese typing instruction for blind users.

---

### 4. LibreOffice 24.8 LTS - ✅ OPTIMAL CHOICE

**Why it's the best:**
- **Excellent NVDA compatibility** via IAccessible2
- **Full Vietnamese** language pack available
- **Completely free** (MPL-2.0)
- **Keyboard-first design** ideal for blind users
- **.odt format** optimized for accessibility
- **Input Help mode** teaches keyboard shortcuts
- **AFB training resources** available for NVDA users

**Alternatives considered:**
| Office Suite | NVDA Support | Cost | Offline | Verdict |
|--------------|--------------|------|---------|---------|
| LibreOffice | Excellent | Free | ✅ | **BEST** |
| MS Office | Excellent | Paid | ✅ | Too expensive |
| OnlyOffice | Beta | Free | ✅ | Not mature enough |
| Google Docs | Good | Free | ❌ | Requires internet |

**Recommendation:** Keep LibreOffice. Best balance of accessibility, cost, and features.

---

### 5. Firefox ESR 128 - ✅ OPTIMAL CHOICE

**Why it's the best:**
- **Gold standard** for NVDA browse mode compatibility
- **Full Vietnamese** language support
- **Lightweight** (~300-400 MB RAM vs Chrome's 600-800 MB)
- **ESR stability** - security updates through March 2026
- **Open source** (MPL-2.0)
- **Best offline caching** of web pages

**Alternatives considered:**
| Browser | NVDA Support | Memory | Verdict |
|---------|--------------|--------|---------|
| Firefox ESR | Excellent | Low | **BEST** |
| Edge | Excellent | Medium | Good backup |
| Chrome | Good | High | Too heavy |

**Recommendation:** Keep Firefox ESR as primary. Edge is pre-installed as backup if needed.

---

### 6. VLC Media Player 3.0 - ⚠️ KEEP WITH MODIFICATION

**Current status:**
- VLC works with NVDA but requires **add-on for full accessibility**
- Without add-on: limited control navigation and status announcements

**Required NVDA add-on:**
- **"VLC Accessibility Enhancement"** - provides:
  - Tab navigation between controls
  - Automatic state change announcements (play/pause/volume)
  - Duration and elapsed time reading
  - Status bar information

**Recommendation:**
- Keep VLC
- **Add to deployment:** Install "VLC Accessibility Enhancement" NVDA add-on
- Update scripts to download and install the add-on

---

### 7. 7-Zip 24.x - ❌ REMOVE (NOT NEEDED)

**Why it's unnecessary:**
- **Windows 11 (24H2)** now has built-in support for:
  - Creating: ZIP, 7z, TAR files
  - Extracting: ZIP, 7z, RAR, TAR, GZ, BZ2, XZ
- Built-in compression works with NVDA keyboard navigation
- Removes one unnecessary software component
- Simplifies deployment

**When you might need 7-Zip:**
- Password-protected archives (unlikely for children's education)
- Creating RAR files (not needed)

**Recommendation:** Remove 7-Zip from deployment. Use Windows 11 built-in compression.

---

## Additional Software Recommendations

### Add: Educational Games (Highly Recommended)

Games provide motivation and engagement for children learning. All free and accessible:

| Game | Type | Source | Notes |
|------|------|--------|-------|
| **LEAP Games** | 3 educational games | SciFY.org | Free, open-source, keyboard/NVDA |
| **AudioGames.net games** | Racing, puzzles, word | audiogames.net | Free, audio-based |
| **Ballyland** | Keyboard learning | ballyland.com | High contrast, young children |

**Recommendation:** Include LEAP Games installer in deployment kit. Create bookmark file for AudioGames.net.

### Add: NVDA Add-ons

| Add-on | Purpose | Priority |
|--------|---------|----------|
| **VLC Accessibility Enhancement** | Media player accessibility | Required if using VLC |
| **Control Help** | Shows help for controls (NVDA+H) | Helpful for beginners |

### Already Included (No Action Needed)

- **Windows Notepad** - Simple text editing (built-in)
- **Windows Calculator** - Math (built-in)
- **Microsoft Edge** - Backup browser (built-in)

---

## Revised Software Stack

### Final Recommended Stack

| Component | Software | Version | Action |
|-----------|----------|---------|--------|
| Screen Reader | NVDA | 2025.3.2 | Keep |
| Vietnamese TTS | Sao Mai VNVoice | 1.0 | Keep |
| Typing Tutor | Sao Mai Typing Tutor | Latest | Keep |
| Office Suite | LibreOffice | 24.8 LTS | Keep |
| Web Browser | Firefox ESR | 128.x | Keep |
| Media Player | VLC + NVDA add-on | 3.0.x | Keep, add NVDA add-on |
| Compression | ~~7-Zip~~ | - | **REMOVE** |
| Educational | LEAP Games | Latest | **ADD** |
| NVDA Add-on | VLC Accessibility Enhancement | Latest | **ADD** |

### Cost Summary: **$0** (unchanged)

---

## Implementation Changes Required

### 1. Remove 7-Zip from scripts
- Edit `1-Install-All.ps1` - remove 7-Zip installation section
- Edit `2-Verify-Installation.ps1` - remove 7-Zip verification
- Edit `0-Download-Installers.ps1` - remove 7-Zip download
- Delete `Installers/Utilities/7z-*.exe` placeholder

### 2. Add NVDA Add-ons
- Download VLC Accessibility Enhancement add-on (.nvda-addon file)
- Add to `Installers/NVDA/addons/` folder
- Update `3-Configure-NVDA.ps1` to install add-on

### 3. Add Educational Games (Optional)
- Download LEAP Games installer
- Add to `Installers/Educational/` folder
- Update installation script

### 4. Update Documentation
- Update README.md with revised software stack
- Update Installers/README.md download list
- Remove 7-Zip references from all docs

---

## Verification Plan

After implementing changes:
1. Run full deployment on test Windows 11 PC
2. Verify VLC works with NVDA add-on
3. Confirm Windows 11 built-in compression handles ZIP files
4. Test all software offline
5. Time the deployment (should be slightly faster without 7-Zip)

---

## Summary

**Current stack is 90% optimal.** Only changes needed:

| Change | Reason |
|--------|--------|
| ❌ Remove 7-Zip | Windows 11 has built-in support |
| ➕ Add VLC NVDA add-on | Required for full accessibility |
| ➕ Add LEAP Games (optional) | Educational engagement |

**No changes to core accessibility software** - NVDA, Sao Mai VNVoice, Sao Mai Typing Tutor, LibreOffice, and Firefox ESR are all optimal choices for this use case.

lines: -# Vietnam Assistive Technology Lab Deployment Plan
-**Project:** Blind Children's Computer Lab - Vietnam Orphanages
-**Support Partner:** Sao Mai Center for the Blind (active partnership)
-**Users:** 10+ children, complete beginners to basic computer familiarity

-Deploy a fully **offline, open-source** assistive technology lab enabling blind children to learn computing through **simultaneous speech and braille output** from day one. The deployment must be completed in 1-3 days on-site, with Sao Mai Center staff providing ongoing support and training.
-- Pre-configure everything before arrival (USB deployment kit)
-- Sao Mai partnership for post-deployment support

toolUseResult.originalFile:
# Vietnam Assistive Technology Lab Deployment Plan
**Project:** Blind Children's Computer Lab - Vietnam Orphanages
**Timeline:** April 2026 deployment (1-3 days on-site)
**Equipment:** 10 Windows 11 PCs (purchased), 10 Orbit Reader 20 devices (purchased)
**Support Partner:** Sao Mai Center for the Blind (active partnership)
**Users:** 10+ children, complete beginners to basic computer familiarity

---

## Executive Summary

Deploy a fully **offline, open-source** assistive technology lab enabling blind children to learn computing through **simultaneous speech and braille output** from day one. The deployment must be completed in 1-3 days on-site, with Sao Mai Center staff providing ongoing support and training.

**Critical Success Factors:**
- Pre-configure everything before arrival (USB deployment kit)
- Automated, scripted installation for speed
- Zero internet dependency
- Sao Mai partnership for post-deployment support
- Documentation in Vietnamese and English

---

## Revised Software Stack (100% Free/Open Source)

| Component | Version | License | Notes |
|-----------|---------|---------|-------|
| **Windows 11** | Pre-installed OEM | OEM License | Already on purchased PCs |
| **NVDA** | 2025.3.2 (latest stable) | GPL-2.0 | Includes Vietnamese interface |
| **Sao Mai VNVoice** | v1.0 | Free for non-commercial | Vietnamese TTS (Minh Du/Mai Dung voices), SAPI5 |
| **Sao Mai Typing Tutor (SMTT)** | Latest | Free | Vietnamese typing lessons with speech |
| **LibreOffice** | 24.8.x LTS | MPL-2.0 | Replace MS Office - free, fully accessible |
| **Firefox** | ESR 128.x | MPL-2.0 | Better accessibility than Chrome, offline installer |
| **VLC Media Player** | 3.0.x | GPL-2.0 | Media playback |
| **7-Zip** | 24.x | LGPL | File compression |

### Key Changes from Original Plan:
1. **Removed Microsoft Office** → Replaced with LibreOffice (fully free, excellent NVDA support)
2. **Added Sao Mai Typing Tutor** → Free Vietnamese typing tutor built for blind users
3. **Firefox ESR** instead of Edge → Better long-term support, fully open source
4. **All software confirmed free** for non-commercial educational use

---

## Pre-Deployment Preparation (Before April Trip)

### 1. Build the Deployment USB Kit (2-3 weeks before travel)

**USB Structure:**
```
/USB-LabKit/
├── Installers/
│   ├── NVDA/
│   │   ├── nvda_2025.3.2.exe
│   │   └── nvda-portable.zip (backup)
│   ├── SaoMai/
│   │   ├── SaoMai_VNVoice_1.0.exe
│   │   └── SaoMai_TypingTutor.exe
│   ├── LibreOffice/
│   │   └── LibreOffice_24.8_Win_x86-64.msi
│   ├── Firefox/
│   │   └── Firefox_ESR_128_Setup.exe
│   ├── Utilities/
│   │   ├── VLC-3.0.x.exe
│   │   └── 7z-2400-x64.exe
├── Config/
│   ├── nvda-config/
│   │   └── nvda.ini (pre-configured Vietnamese profile)
│   ├── firefox-profile/
│   │   └── prefs.js (accessibility optimized)
├── Scripts/
│   ├── 1-Install-All.ps1 (main deployment script)
│   ├── 2-Verify-Installation.ps1 (validation script)
│   ├── 3-Configure-NVDA.ps1 (NVDA setup automation)
│   └── README.txt (Vietnamese + English instructions)
├── Training/
│   ├── NVDA-Basics-VN/ (from Sao Mai)
│   ├── Typing-Lessons-VN/ (SMTT tutorials)
│   ├── LibreOffice-VN/ (basic docs)
│   └── Quick-Start-Guide-VN.docx
├── Documentation/
│   ├── Troubleshooting-Guide-VN.docx
│   ├── Orbit-Reader-Setup-VN.pdf
│   └── Daily-Maintenance-Checklist-VN.docx
└── Backup/
    └── (copies of all installers)
```

### 2. Create PowerShell Deployment Scripts

**Script 1: `1-Install-All.ps1`**
```powershell
# Silent installation script for Vietnam Lab deployment
# Run as Administrator

Write-Host "Starting Vietnam Lab Setup..." -ForegroundColor Green

# Install NVDA
Write-Host "Installing NVDA..."
Start-Process -FilePath ".\Installers\NVDA\nvda_2025.3.2.exe" `
    -ArgumentList "--install-silent", "--minimal", "--log-level=20" `
    -Wait -NoNewWindow

# Install VNVoice
Write-Host "Installing Sao Mai VNVoice..."
Start-Process -FilePath ".\Installers\SaoMai\SaoMai_VNVoice_1.0.exe" `
    -ArgumentList "/S" -Wait -NoNewWindow

# Install Sao Mai Typing Tutor
Write-Host "Installing Sao Mai Typing Tutor..."
Start-Process -FilePath ".\Installers\SaoMai\SaoMai_TypingTutor.exe" `
    -ArgumentList "/S" -Wait -NoNewWindow

# Install LibreOffice
Write-Host "Installing LibreOffice..."
Start-Process -FilePath "msiexec.exe" `
    -ArgumentList "/i", ".\Installers\LibreOffice\LibreOffice_24.8_Win_x86-64.msi", "/quiet", "/norestart" `
    -Wait -NoNewWindow

# Install Firefox ESR
Write-Host "Installing Firefox ESR..."
Start-Process -FilePath ".\Installers\Firefox\Firefox_ESR_128_Setup.exe" `
    -ArgumentList "-ms" -Wait -NoNewWindow

# Install VLC
Write-Host "Installing VLC..."
Start-Process -FilePath ".\Installers\Utilities\VLC-3.0.x.exe" `
    -ArgumentList "/S" -Wait -NoNewWindow

# Install 7-Zip
Write-Host "Installing 7-Zip..."
Start-Process -FilePath ".\Installers\Utilities\7z-2400-x64.exe" `
    -ArgumentList "/S" -Wait -NoNewWindow

Write-Host "Installation complete! Run 3-Configure-NVDA.ps1 next." -ForegroundColor Green
```

**Script 2: `3-Configure-NVDA.ps1`**
```powershell
# NVDA Configuration for Vietnamese users
Write-Host "Configuring NVDA for Vietnamese..." -ForegroundColor Green

$nvdaConfigPath = "$env:APPDATA\nvda\nvda.ini"
$sourceConfig = ".\Config\nvda-config\nvda.ini"

# Copy pre-configured NVDA profile
if (Test-Path $sourceConfig) {
    Copy-Item $sourceConfig $nvdaConfigPath -Force
    Write-Host "NVDA configuration applied" -ForegroundColor Green
} else {
    Write-Host "Warning: Pre-configured NVDA profile not found" -ForegroundColor Yellow
}

# Set NVDA to auto-start
$startupPath = "$env:APPDATA\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Startup"
$nvdaShortcut = "$env:ProgramFiles\NVDA\nvda.exe"
$WshShell = New-Object -ComObject WScript.Shell
$Shortcut = $WshShell.CreateShortcut("$startupPath\NVDA.lnk")
$Shortcut.TargetPath = $nvdaShortcut
$Shortcut.Save()

Write-Host "NVDA set to auto-start on login" -ForegroundColor Green
```

**Script 3: `2-Verify-Installation.ps1`**
```powershell
# Verification script to check all software installed correctly
Write-Host "Verifying installation..." -ForegroundColor Cyan

$checks = @{
    "NVDA" = Test-Path "C:\Program Files\NVDA\nvda.exe"
    "VNVoice" = Test-Path "C:\Windows\Speech\Engines\TTS\*vnvoice*"
    "LibreOffice" = Test-Path "C:\Program Files\LibreOffice\program\soffice.exe"
    "Firefox" = Test-Path "C:\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox\firefox.exe"
    "VLC" = Test-Path "C:\Program Files\VideoLAN\VLC\vlc.exe"
    "7-Zip" = Test-Path "C:\Program Files\7-Zip\7z.exe"
    "Typing Tutor" = Test-Path "C:\Program Files\SaoMai\TypingTutor\*"
}

foreach ($software in $checks.Keys) {
    if ($checks[$software]) {
        Write-Host "[OK] $software installed" -ForegroundColor Green
    } else {
        Write-Host "[FAIL] $software NOT found" -ForegroundColor Red
    }
}

Write-Host "`nVerification complete!" -ForegroundColor Cyan
```

### 3. Pre-Configure NVDA Profile

Create a master `nvda.ini` file with these settings:
```ini
[speech]
synth = sapi5
symbolLevel = 100
autoLanguageSwitching = True

[sapi5]
voice = Minh Du

[general]
language = vi
saveConfigurationOnExit = True
playStartAndExitSounds = True

[braille]
display = aph/orbitReader20
translationTable = vietnamese-g1.utb
tetherTo = focus

[keyboard]
handleKeys = True
beepForLowercaseWithCapslock = True
speakTypedCharacters = True
speakTypedWords = True
```

### 4. Coordinate with Sao Mai Center (2-4 weeks before)

- **Request:**
  - Vietnamese NVDA tutorial materials (HTML/DOCX format)
  - Vietnamese typing tutor lessons for SMTT
  - LibreOffice basic tutorials in Vietnamese
  - Troubleshooting guide in Vietnamese

- **Confirm:**
  - Sao Mai staff will be available during deployment (remote or on-site)
  - Post-deployment support plan (weekly check-ins? monthly training?)
  - Contact information for technical support

### 5. Hardware Preparation Checklist

**For each of the 10 PCs:**
- [ ] Windows 11 fully updated (before leaving for Vietnam)
- [ ] All manufacturer bloatware removed
- [ ] User account created (simple password, documented)
- [ ] Power settings: never sleep, never turn off display
- [ ] Windows Defender configured (offline mode)
- [ ] Unplug from internet after updates complete

**For each of the 10 Orbit Reader 20:**
- [ ] Fully charged
- [ ] Firmware updated to latest version
- [ ] USB cables included
- [ ] Tested with NVDA on at least one test PC

**Additional Equipment:**
- [ ] 10x wired headphones (over-ear, 3.5mm jack, durable)
- [ ] 10x USB extension cables (for Orbit Reader flexibility)
- [ ] 2x backup USB drives with deployment kit
- [ ] Ethernet switch + cables (in case internet needed for troubleshooting)
- [ ] Label maker for PC numbering (PC-1 through PC-10)

---

## On-Site Deployment (1-3 Days in Vietnam)

### Day 1: Physical Setup & Software Installation (6-8 hours)

**Morning (9 AM - 12 PM):**
1. **Unpack and arrange equipment** (1 hour)
   - Set up all 10 PCs on desks
   - Label each PC (1-10) with physical labels
   - Connect power, keyboards, mice
   - Test power and boot sequence

2. **Run deployment script on all PCs** (2-3 hours)
   - PC #1: Run full installation, verify success
   - PCs #2-10: Run in parallel (batch of 3-4 at a time)
   - Monitor for errors using verification script
   - Document any issues immediately

**Lunch Break (12 PM - 1 PM)**

**Afternoon (1 PM - 5 PM):**
3. **Configure NVDA and test speech** (2 hours)
   - Run configuration script on all PCs
   - Test VNVoice speech output on each PC
   - Adjust volume levels
   - Verify auto-start functionality

4. **Connect Orbit Reader 20 devices** (2 hours)
   - Plug in one Orbit Reader per PC
   - Verify NVDA auto-detects as "APH Orbit Reader 20"
   - Test braille output with sample text
   - Configure braille translation table (Vietnamese Grade 1)
   - Label each Orbit Reader to match PC number

5. **End-of-day verification** (30 min)
   - Run verification script on all 10 PCs
   - Document any failures
   - Plan fixes for Day 2

### Day 2: Configuration, Testing & Training Prep (6-8 hours)

**Morning (9 AM - 12 PM):**
1. **Fix any Day 1 issues** (1-2 hours)
   - Reinstall failed software
   - Troubleshoot hardware connections
   - Verify all 10 stations functional

2. **Deploy training materials** (1 hour)
   - Copy `/Training` folder to each PC's Desktop
   - Create desktop shortcuts to key resources
   - Test accessibility of training documents

3. **Configure user experience** (1 hour)
   - Set up simple desktop layouts
   - Pin key applications to taskbar
   - Remove unnecessary icons
   - Test keyboard navigation flow

**Afternoon (1 PM - 5 PM):**
4. **Conduct walkthrough with Sao Mai staff** (2-3 hours)
   - Demonstrate each station
   - Train on troubleshooting process
   - Review verification scripts
   - Practice common fixes (restart NVDA, reconnect Orbit Reader)

5. **Create station documentation** (1 hour)
   - Print quick-reference guides for each station
   - Create laminated troubleshooting flowchart
   - Document PC-specific notes (e.g., "PC-3: USB port 2 preferred")

6. **Pilot test with 1-2 students** (1 hour)
   - If available, test with actual users
   - Observe pain points
   - Adjust configurations as needed

### Day 3: Final Testing & Handoff (4-6 hours)

**Morning (9 AM - 12 PM):**
1. **Full lab walkthrough** (1 hour)
   - Test every station end-to-end
   - Student perspective: power on → log in → use NVDA → type → open document
   - Fix any remaining issues

2. **Train Sao Mai staff on maintenance** (2 hours)
   - USB deployment kit usage
   - How to rebuild a PC from scratch
   - Common problems and solutions
   - Contact procedures for remote support

**Afternoon (1 PM - 3 PM):**
3. **Documentation handoff** (1 hour)
   - Transfer all documentation to Sao Mai
   - Digital copies + printed binders
   - Review emergency contact info

4. **Final sign-off** (30 min)
   - Walk through checklist with Sao Mai leadership
   - Confirm ongoing support plan
   - Schedule first follow-up check-in (1 week post-deployment)

---

## Critical Technical Details

### NVDA Configuration for Orbit Reader 20

1. **Auto-Detection:** Orbit Reader 20 uses HID mode with NVDA (no drivers needed)
2. **Connection:** USB preferred over Bluetooth for reliability in lab setting
3. **Braille Table:** Set to `vietnamese-g1.utb` (Vietnamese Grade 1)
4. **Tether Mode:** Set to "focus" so braille follows keyboard cursor
5. **Keyboard Shortcuts:**
   - `NVDA+Control+A`: Braille settings
   - `NVDA+T`: Read title bar
   - `NVDA+B`: Read status bar

### LibreOffice Accessibility Setup

1. Enable "Support assistive technology tools" in Tools → Options → Accessibility
2. Set default to `.odt` format (best NVDA support)
3. Pre-configure Vietnamese language and keyboard layout
4. Disable animated graphics and auto-correct (reduces screen reader noise)

### Offline Mode Verification

**Test each PC completely offline:**
- [ ] NVDA starts and speaks
- [ ] VNVoice synthesizer available
- [ ] Orbit Reader outputs braille
- [ ] LibreOffice opens and is readable
- [ ] Typing Tutor launches and speaks
- [ ] Firefox can open local HTML files (training materials)
- [ ] All keyboard shortcuts functional

---

## Training Materials Checklist (from Sao Mai)

1. **NVDA Basics** (Vietnamese)
   - Turning NVDA on/off
   - Basic navigation (arrow keys, Tab, Enter)
   - Reading text (say all, line by line, word by word)
   - Forms and buttons
   - Keyboard shortcuts reference

2. **Sao Mai Typing Tutor Lessons**
   - Lesson 1: Home row keys (ASDF JKL;)
   - Lesson 2: Top row (QWERTY)
   - Lesson 3: Bottom row (ZXCV)
   - Lesson 4: Numbers and punctuation
   - Lesson 5: Vietnamese diacritics
   - Progressive difficulty with audio feedback

3. **LibreOffice Writer** (Vietnamese)
   - Creating a document
   - Basic formatting (bold, italic, headings)
   - Saving and opening files
   - Keyboard shortcuts for editing

4. **Orbit Reader 20 Introduction** (Vietnamese)
   - Physical buttons and functions
   - Reading braille vs. typing mode
   - Charging and maintenance
   - Troubleshooting connection issues

---

## Troubleshooting Guide (For Sao Mai Staff)

### Issue: NVDA Not Speaking

**Diagnosis:**
1. Press `NVDA+S` to toggle speech mode (may be in "off" mode)
2. Check if VNVoice is selected: `NVDA+Control+S` → Synthesizer settings
3. Check volume: both system volume and NVDA volume

**Fix:**
1. Restart NVDA: `Insert+Q`, then relaunch
2. If no sound, run: `C:\Program Files\NVDA\nvda.exe -c configFile` (reset config)
3. Re-run `3-Configure-NVDA.ps1` from USB kit

### Issue: Orbit Reader Not Detected

**Diagnosis:**
1. Check USB connection (try different port)
2. Check if device is charged
3. NVDA → Preferences → Braille → Display shows "No braille"

**Fix:**
1. Disconnect and reconnect USB cable
2. Restart NVDA
3. Manually select "APH Orbit Reader 20" in Braille settings
4. If still fails, restart PC with Orbit Reader connected

### Issue: LibreOffice Not Readable with NVDA

**Diagnosis:**
1. NVDA is silent when navigating menus
2. Document content not announced

**Fix:**
1. Open LibreOffice → Tools → Options → Accessibility
2. Enable "Support assistive technology tools"
3. Restart LibreOffice
4. If still fails, reinstall LibreOffice using USB kit

### Issue: Typing Tutor Audio Not Working

**Diagnosis:**
1. Program launches but no voice feedback
2. Headphones not connected or low volume

**Fix:**
1. Check headphone connection to PC (not Orbit Reader)
2. Verify system volume is at 50%+
3. Check Typing Tutor audio settings (may have separate volume)
4. Try different headphones to rule out hardware failure

### Issue: PC Won't Boot / Software Corruption

**Fix:**
1. Boot PC to Windows normally
2. Insert USB deployment kit
3. Re-run `1-Install-All.ps1` (will overwrite existing installations)
4. Re-run `3-Configure-NVDA.ps1`
5. Run verification script
6. If complete failure, contact remote support team

---

## Post-Deployment Support Plan

### Week 1-2: Intensive Monitoring
- **Daily check-in** with Sao Mai staff (WhatsApp/Signal/Email)
- Remote troubleshooting via SSH if needed (requires internet connection)
- Document all issues for pattern identification

### Week 3-4: Stabilization
- **Every 2-3 days** check-in
- Review student feedback and usage patterns
- Adjust configurations based on real-world use

### Month 2+: Ongoing Support
- **Weekly** check-in call with Sao Mai
- **Monthly** review of lab usage and student progress
- **Quarterly** plan for equipment maintenance/upgrades

### Emergency Contact Protocol
1. **Minor issues:** Email to support team (response within 24 hours)
2. **Major outage:** WhatsApp/Signal to on-call technician (response within 4 hours)
3. **Critical failure:** Emergency call to project lead (immediate response)

---

## Success Metrics (3-Month Evaluation)

1. **Technical Reliability:** 90%+ uptime across all 10 stations
2. **User Adoption:** All students can independently log in and launch NVDA
3. **Skill Progression:** 80%+ students complete typing tutor Lesson 3
4. **Equipment Durability:** No major hardware failures
5. **Staff Confidence:** Sao Mai staff can handle 90%+ of issues independently

---

## Budget Verification (Software = $0 Confirmed)

| Item | Cost | License |
|------|------|---------|
| NVDA | FREE | GPL-2.0 (open source) |
| Sao Mai VNVoice | FREE | Free for non-commercial use |
| Sao Mai Typing Tutor | FREE | Free for non-commercial use |
| LibreOffice | FREE | MPL-2.0 (open source) |
| Firefox ESR | FREE | MPL-2.0 (open source) |
| VLC | FREE | GPL-2.0 (open source) |
| 7-Zip | FREE | LGPL (open source) |
| **Total Software Cost** | **$0** | ✅ 100% Free/Open Source |

**Hardware (already purchased):**
- 10x Windows 11 PCs ✅
- 10x Orbit Reader 20 ✅
- Headphones, cables, accessories (estimate: $200-500)

---

## Risk Assessment & Mitigation

### Risk 1: Limited On-Site Time (1-3 days)
**Mitigation:**
- Pre-configure everything possible before travel
- Automated scripts reduce manual work
- Parallel installation on multiple PCs
- Sao Mai staff trained to finish any incomplete tasks

### Risk 2: Hardware Compatibility Issues
**Mitigation:**
- Test deployment on one PC before traveling
- USB kit includes multiple installer versions
- Backup portable NVDA version if installation fails
- Document all PC specs before arrival

### Risk 3: Language Barriers
**Mitigation:**
- All documentation in Vietnamese and English
- Sao Mai staff bilingual and involved throughout
- Visual/printed guides with screenshots
- Pre-translated error messages and solutions

### Risk 4: No Internet for Troubleshooting
**Mitigation:**
- Entire stack works 100% offline
- USB kit contains everything needed for reinstallation
- Printed troubleshooting guides
- Sao Mai staff trained on common fixes

### Risk 5: Student Overwhelm (Both Speech + Braille Day 1)
**Mitigation:**
- Gradual introduction: speech first, then add braille awareness
- Sao Mai instructors experienced in dual-modality teaching
- Typing tutor starts with simple exercises
- Training materials allow self-paced learning

---

## Pre-Flight Checklist (Before Traveling to Vietnam)

**2 Weeks Before:**
- [ ] All software downloaded to USB kit
- [ ] Scripts written and tested
- [ ] NVDA config file pre-configured
- [ ] Training materials received from Sao Mai
- [ ] All documentation translated to Vietnamese
- [ ] Test complete deployment on 1 PC at home

**1 Week Before:**
- [ ] Confirm Sao Mai staff availability during deployment
- [ ] Schedule daily check-in times
- [ ] Create emergency contact list
- [ ] Print all physical documentation
- [ ] Create 2 backup USB kits (3 total)
- [ ] Charge Orbit Readers fully

**Day Before Travel:**
- [ ] USB kits packed (3 copies)
- [ ] Laptop + charger for troubleshooting
- [ ] Printed documentation + binders
- [ ] Headphones for testing
- [ ] USB cables and adapters
- [ ] Label maker + extra labels
- [ ] Confirm flight + accommodation
- [ ] Share trip itinerary with team

---

## Appendix: Software Download URLs

**Prepare these before traveling (offline installers):**

1. **NVDA:** https://www.nvaccess.org/download/
   - Download "Installer" version for all PCs
   - Download "Portable" version as backup

2. **Sao Mai VNVoice:** https://saomaicenter.org/en/downloads
   - Vietnamese TTS engine (SAPI5)
   - Includes Minh Du and Mai Dung voices

3. **Sao Mai Typing Tutor:** https://saomaicenter.org/en/downloads/vietnamese-talking-software/sao-mai-typing-tutor-smtt
   - Free Vietnamese typing lessons
   - Built-in speech support

4. **LibreOffice:** https://www.libreoffice.org/download/download/
   - Select "Windows x86-64 (MSI)" for offline deployment
   - Version 24.8.x LTS recommended

5. **Firefox ESR:** https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/enterprise/
   - Download "Windows 64-bit MSI" installer
   - ESR = Extended Support Release (stable)

6. **VLC:** https://www.videolan.org/vlc/
   - Download Windows 64-bit installer
   - Select "Standard installation"

7. **7-Zip:** https://www.7-zip.org/
   - Download Windows x64 installer

---

## Next Steps Before April

1. **Test full deployment on one PC** to validate scripts and timing
2. **Coordinate with Sao Mai** to receive Vietnamese training materials
3. **Create printed documentation** with screenshots and step-by-step guides
4. **Order headphones and accessories** if not already purchased
5. **Schedule deployment dates** with orphanage and Sao Mai staff
6. **Book travel and accommodation** for April trip
7. **Run through deployment rehearsal** with stopwatch to verify 1-3 day timeline

---

**Plan prepared by:** Claude Code
**Date:** February 4, 2026
**Status:** Ready for review and approval

input.plan:
# Software Stack Review - Vietnam Assistive Technology Lab

## Purpose
Validate that the current software choices are optimal for blind children in Vietnam learning computing with no internet access.

---

## Current Software Stack

| Component | Current Choice | Status |
|-----------|----------------|--------|
| Screen Reader | NVDA 2025.3.2 | ✅ **OPTIMAL** |
| Vietnamese TTS | Sao Mai VNVoice v1.0 | ✅ **GOOD** (consider testing alternative) |
| Typing Tutor | Sao Mai Typing Tutor | ✅ **OPTIMAL** |
| Office Suite | LibreOffice 24.8 LTS | ✅ **OPTIMAL** |
| Web Browser | Firefox ESR 128 | ✅ **OPTIMAL** |
| Media Player | VLC 3.0 | ⚠️ **KEEP** (needs NVDA add-on) |
| Compression | 7-Zip 24.x | ❌ **REMOVE** (not needed) |

---

## Detailed Analysis

### 1. NVDA 2025.3.2 - ✅ OPTIMAL CHOICE

**Why it's the best:**
- **Only screen reader** with full Vietnamese interface, TTS, and braille support
- **Free** (GPL-2.0) - no cost barriers
- **100% offline** after download
- **Orbit Reader 20** fully supported (HID mode, auto-detected)
- **Vietnamese Grade 1 braille** translation table included (`vietnamese-g1.utb`)
- **Proven in Vietnamese schools** - used at Nguyen Dinh Chieu School
- **Sao Mai Center partnership** - Vietnamese training materials at nvda.vn
- **Simplest learning curve** for beginners/children

**Alternatives considered:**
| Screen Reader | Vietnamese Support | Cost | Verdict |
|---------------|-------------------|------|---------|
| NVDA | ✅ Full | Free | **BEST** |
| JAWS | ❌ None | $90+/year | Not suitable |
| Windows Narrator | ❓ Limited | Free | Inadequate features |

**Recommendation:** Keep NVDA. No changes needed.

---

### 2. Sao Mai VNVoice v1.0 - ✅ GOOD (Test Alternative)

**Current choice strengths:**
- **Two female voices:** Minh Du, Mai Dung
- **SAPI5 compliant** - excellent NVDA integration
- **Proven** - used by Vietnamese blind community since ~2002
- **Free** for non-commercial use
- **Reliable organization** - Sao Mai Center established since 2001

**Potential concern:**
- Older concatenative synthesis technology (may sound less natural than modern neural TTS)
- No recent user reviews on voice quality for children

**Alternative to consider testing:**
| TTS Option | Voices | Technology | Quality |
|------------|--------|------------|---------|
| Sao Mai VNVoice | 2 female | Concatenative | Proven/adequate |
| **NHMTTS** | 1 male, 1 female | Neural network | Potentially better |
| Windows "An" | 1 male only | Neural | Unknown quality |
| eSpeak-NG | 1 generic | Formula-based | **Poor** - avoid |

**Recommendation:**
- Keep Sao Mai VNVoice as primary choice
- **Optional:** Download and test NHMTTS alongside to compare voice quality
- Avoid eSpeak-NG (confirmed poor Vietnamese pronunciation)

---

### 3. Sao Mai Typing Tutor - ✅ OPTIMAL CHOICE

**Why it's the best:**
- **Purpose-built** for Vietnamese blind users
- **Speech feedback** built-in
- **Progressive lessons** (home row → full keyboard → Vietnamese diacritics)
- **Free** from Sao Mai Center
- **Offline operation**
- **No alternative** offers this combination for Vietnamese

**Recommendation:** Keep. This is the only viable option for Vietnamese typing instruction for blind users.

---

### 4. LibreOffice 24.8 LTS - ✅ OPTIMAL CHOICE

**Why it's the best:**
- **Excellent NVDA compatibility** via IAccessible2
- **Full Vietnamese** language pack available
- **Completely free** (MPL-2.0)
- **Keyboard-first design** ideal for blind users
- **.odt format** optimized for accessibility
- **Input Help mode** teaches keyboard shortcuts
- **AFB training resources** available for NVDA users

**Alternatives considered:**
| Office Suite | NVDA Support | Cost | Offline | Verdict |
|--------------|--------------|------|---------|---------|
| LibreOffice | Excellent | Free | ✅ | **BEST** |
| MS Office | Excellent | Paid | ✅ | Too expensive |
| OnlyOffice | Beta | Free | ✅ | Not mature enough |
| Google Docs | Good | Free | ❌ | Requires internet |

**Recommendation:** Keep LibreOffice. Best balance of accessibility, cost, and features.

---

### 5. Firefox ESR 128 - ✅ OPTIMAL CHOICE

**Why it's the best:**
- **Gold standard** for NVDA browse mode compatibility
- **Full Vietnamese** language support
- **Lightweight** (~300-400 MB RAM vs Chrome's 600-800 MB)
- **ESR stability** - security updates through March 2026
- **Open source** (MPL-2.0)
- **Best offline caching** of web pages

**Alternatives considered:**
| Browser | NVDA Support | Memory | Verdict |
|---------|--------------|--------|---------|
| Firefox ESR | Excellent | Low | **BEST** |
| Edge | Excellent | Medium | Good backup |
| Chrome | Good | High | Too heavy |

**Recommendation:** Keep Firefox ESR as primary. Edge is pre-installed as backup if needed.

---

### 6. VLC Media Player 3.0 - ⚠️ KEEP WITH MODIFICATION

**Current status:**
- VLC works with NVDA but requires **add-on for full accessibility**
- Without add-on: limited control navigation and status announcements

**Required NVDA add-on:**
- **"VLC Accessibility Enhancement"** - provides:
  - Tab navigation between controls
  - Automatic state change announcements (play/pause/volume)
  - Duration and elapsed time reading
  - Status bar information

**Recommendation:**
- Keep VLC
- **Add to deployment:** Install "VLC Accessibility Enhancement" NVDA add-on
- Update scripts to download and install the add-on

---

### 7. 7-Zip 24.x - ❌ REMOVE (NOT NEEDED)

**Why it's unnecessary:**
- **Windows 11 (24H2)** now has built-in support for:
  - Creating: ZIP, 7z, TAR files
  - Extracting: ZIP, 7z, RAR, TAR, GZ, BZ2, XZ
- Built-in compression works with NVDA keyboard navigation
- Removes one unnecessary software component
- Simplifies deployment

**When you might need 7-Zip:**
- Password-protected archives (unlikely for children's education)
- Creating RAR files (not needed)

**Recommendation:** Remove 7-Zip from deployment. Use Windows 11 built-in compression.

---

## Additional Software Recommendations

### Add: Educational Games (Highly Recommended)

Games provide motivation and engagement for children learning. All free and accessible:

| Game | Type | Source | Notes |
|------|------|--------|-------|
| **LEAP Games** | 3 educational games | SciFY.org | Free, open-source, keyboard/NVDA |
| **AudioGames.net games** | Racing, puzzles, word | audiogames.net | Free, audio-based |
| **Ballyland** | Keyboard learning | ballyland.com | High contrast, young children |

**Recommendation:** Include LEAP Games installer in deployment kit. Create bookmark file for AudioGames.net.

### Add: NVDA Add-ons

| Add-on | Purpose | Priority |
|--------|---------|----------|
| **VLC Accessibility Enhancement** | Media player accessibility | Required if using VLC |
| **Control Help** | Shows help for controls (NVDA+H) | Helpful for beginners |

### Already Included (No Action Needed)

- **Windows Notepad** - Simple text editing (built-in)
- **Windows Calculator** - Math (built-in)
- **Microsoft Edge** - Backup browser (built-in)

---

## Revised Software Stack

### Final Recommended Stack

| Component | Software | Version | Action |
|-----------|----------|---------|--------|
| Screen Reader | NVDA | 2025.3.2 | Keep |
| Vietnamese TTS | Sao Mai VNVoice | 1.0 | Keep |
| Typing Tutor | Sao Mai Typing Tutor | Latest | Keep |
| Office Suite | LibreOffice | 24.8 LTS | Keep |
| Web Browser | Firefox ESR | 128.x | Keep |
| Media Player | VLC + NVDA add-on | 3.0.x | Keep, add NVDA add-on |
| Compression | ~~7-Zip~~ | - | **REMOVE** |
| Educational | LEAP Games | Latest | **ADD** |
| NVDA Add-on | VLC Accessibility Enhancement | Latest | **ADD** |

### Cost Summary: **$0** (unchanged)

---

## Implementation Changes Required

### 1. Remove 7-Zip from scripts
- Edit `1-Install-All.ps1` - remove 7-Zip installation section
- Edit `2-Verify-Installation.ps1` - remove 7-Zip verification
- Edit `0-Download-Installers.ps1` - remove 7-Zip download
- Delete `Installers/Utilities/7z-*.exe` placeholder

### 2. Add NVDA Add-ons
- Download VLC Accessibility Enhancement add-on (.nvda-addon file)
- Add to `Installers/NVDA/addons/` folder
- Update `3-Configure-NVDA.ps1` to install add-on

### 3. Add Educational Games (Optional)
- Download LEAP Games installer
- Add to `Installers/Educational/` folder
- Update installation script

### 4. Update Documentation
- Update README.md with revised software stack
- Update Installers/README.md download list
- Remove 7-Zip references from all docs

---

## Verification Plan

After implementing changes:
1. Run full deployment on test Windows 11 PC
2. Verify VLC works with NVDA add-on
3. Confirm Windows 11 built-in compression handles ZIP files
4. Test all software offline
5. Time the deployment (should be slightly faster without 7-Zip)

---

## Summary

**Current stack is 90% optimal.** Only changes needed:

| Change | Reason |
|--------|--------|
| ❌ Remove 7-Zip | Windows 11 has built-in support |
| ➕ Add VLC NVDA add-on | Required for full accessibility |
| ➕ Add LEAP Games (optional) | Educational engagement |

**No changes to core accessibility software** - NVDA, Sao Mai VNVoice, Sao Mai Typing Tutor, LibreOffice, and Firefox ESR are all optimal choices for this use case.
